titleproper.value: Guide to the New York City Labor Chorus Records <num>WAG.361</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Amy C. Vo

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2020-01-13T21:13:45</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: New York City Labor Chorus Records

extent.value: in 1 half manuscript box and 2 oversize folders.

abstract.value: The New York City Labor Chorus, with 75 members representing over 20 local unions and District Councils, was founded in 1991. Its music focuses on the message of workers' history and their struggles for social and economic justice. This collection contains posters, programs, and CDs from the choral organization, representing a sample of the celebrations, programming, and events that they organize. There are also notes on concepts, lyrics, and music for the musical theater piece entitled "Soul of the City."

p.value: Identification of item, date; New York City Labor Chorus Records; WAG 361; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Jeffrey Vogel, July 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.003.

The New York City Labor Chorus, with 75 members representing over 20 local unions and District Councils, was founded in 1991. Its music focuses on the message of workers' history and their struggles for social and economic justice.
This collection contains posters, programs, and CDs from the New York City Labor Chorus. There are also notes on concepts, lyrics, and music for the musical theater piece entitled "Soul of the City."
